humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a measurement of the largest tumor size, which is 2.2 cm. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the tumor is measured as 2.2 cm (Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, SBR Grade 1). According to the TNM staging system, a T stage of T2 corresponds to a tumor size of 2.1 to 5.0 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
